data.message: It stands for graphic interchage format but we turned it to GIF, it's acronym. For most acronyms we spell it out.. G-I-F. Or do we say acronyms as one whole word now? So PNG is now Pang? Hahahaha.

replies.message: NASA, UNICEF, LASER, TASER, ZIP, PIN, SCUBA, RADAR, JPEG, FUBAR, and SNAFU are some of the many acronyms we pronounce as words.
A lot of acronyms are said as a word lmao
PDT, USA, PC, USB, ATM, RTW, PSN, etc. Hahahaha. I guess we read these as words now as well then.
You don't have to read every acronym as a word. I'm just countering your point about always just saying the letters.
I said most of them, not all.

Sime, you seem to be mixing up acronyms with the more general notion of initialisms. The former requires that it be pronounceable in the language. The latter does not.

In this case, gif is pronounceable (one way or the other), so we can choose to treat it as a word.

On the other hand PNG is not natively pronounceable in English, so the norm world be to state the letters. Despite this norm, a common pronunciation I have heard (and use myself) is ping.
